hanzi-su-wiki:
俺

Значения

Я

Мнемоника

Уничижительное местоимение первого лица, т.е. недостойный Вас раб 亻 которого «из грязи тянут 申 в князи» (чтобы сделать большим 大).
purpleculture_pinyin:
ǎn
I (northern dialects)
I (северные диалекты)
rtega_mnemonic:
俺俺RSpersonal pronoun, I
  • man 亻 covering his penis 奄
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 奄 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 奄 [ yǎn ] to remain, to tarry; feeble
heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. T is such a community guy that he even uses we (exclusive) to refer to himself in an exclusive sense (i.e. instead of "I"). "We are the best hang glider in the world" he says about himself!
heisig_constituent: myself, person, dachshund, large, St. Bernard, eel, sun, day
heisig_story: The key word refers to a very familiar way of referring to oneself, typically used by men. Its component elements: person . . . St. Bernard . . . eel.
koohiiStory1: I did it all by myself! Mr T stands there proud as holding a moray eel in his hand. He´s brought down terrorist organisations, drug syndicates, but gets all worked up when catching a fish... what a guy.
koohiiStory2: As astridtops mentions, this is "Ore". In Japanese r = l, so could write it "Ole". So picture a bullfight with person as the matador and a dachshund replacing the bull. The crowd keep shouting "Ole! (Ore)".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The leader of a big rice paddy is standing in the middle of said rice paddy with an umbrella. Who is this wacky leader? Why, it is I. It is me.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine that this leader is you. Be rough about it, because 俺 is the "rougher" version of "I." You should only use it in casual situations or if you're a badass.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Why am I standing in the middle of this rice paddy with an umbrella? I'm digging for ore (おれ).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: More accurately, I'm standing here with an umbrella so I don't get wet. My minions are doing the ore digging, but I am watching to make sure they don't slack off.
Ru_Radicals: 乙 (второй), 化 (превращаться), 大 (большой), 奄 (Амами)
Ru_trainchinese: ǎn: (местоим) (диал.) мы, нам, наш (не включая того, с кем разговаривают); я, мне, мой
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) suffocating (奄) you is me
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T is such a community guy that he even uses we (exclusive) to refer to himself in an exclusive sense (i.e. instead of "I"). "We are the best hang glider in the world" he says about himself!

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 奄 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 奄 [ yǎn ] to remain, to tarry; feeble
①[方言]我。［例］都道是金玉良缘，俺只念木石前盟。——《红楼梦》。［合］俺那儿(我家里那个。指丈夫)；俺不去。
②[方言]我的。［例］俺爹。
③[方言]我们的。［例］俺村。

ǎn
1) диал. я; мой
与俺为仇 быть со мной во враждебных отношениях
俺女孩儿 я (девушка или девочка о себе)
俺爹 мой отец
2) диал. мы; наш (исключая слушающего)
俺村 наша деревня
Radicals: ｲ, 大, 田, 乚  (leader, big, rice-paddy, umbrella)
Meaning Mnemonic
The leader of a big rice paddy is standing in the middle of said rice paddy with an umbrella. Who is this wacky leader? Why, it is I. It is me.
Imagine that this leader is you. Be rough about it, because 俺 is the "rougher" version of "I." You should only use it in casual situations or if you're a badass.
Reading Mnemonic
Why am I standing in the middle of this rice paddy with an umbrella? I'm digging for ore (おれ).
More accurately, I'm standing here with an umbrella so I don't get wet. My minions are doing the ore digging, but I am watching to make sure they don't slack off.
